docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 29 -- Two persons were killed and eight wounded in a serious clash today between armed Italian Fascists and the enraged populace of Durazno, a small town about sixty miles from here. A regular battle raged in the streets for...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 29 -- Two persons were killed and eight wounded in a serious clash today between armed Italian Fascists and the enraged populace of Durazno, a small town about sixty miles from here. A regular battle raged in the streets for some time between the Fascists, who used revolvers, and the public, who retaliated with stones and other missiles.

headline.main: 2 URUGUAYANS KILLED IN ANTI-FASCIST FIGHT; 8 Others Wounded as Italians Fire Revolvers Into Crowd

docs.snippet: DURAZNO, Uruguay, June 30 (AP) -- The death of a 17-year-old boy today, the second fatality resulting from a street fight yesterday between anti-totalitarian students and guests at an Italian Red Cross benefit, set off a new series of out-breaks this...
docs.lead_paragraph: DURAZNO, Uruguay, June 30 (AP) -- The death of a 17-year-old boy today, the second fatality resulting from a street fight yesterday between anti-totalitarian students and guests at an Italian Red Cross benefit, set off a new series of out-breaks this afternoon.

docs.snippet: The names of three naturalized Germans were added yesterday to the list of twenty-six men and three women arrested by Federal agents over the week-end in a nation-wide spy hunt.
docs.lead_paragraph: The names of three naturalized Germans were added yesterday to the list of twenty-six men and three women arrested by Federal agents over the week-end in a nation-wide spy hunt.

docs.snippet: A former Storm Trooper of the German-American Bund was arrested yesterday by agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation as a member of the alleged espionage ring uncovered over the week-end. His arrest brought to thirty-three the number of men and...
docs.lead_paragraph: A former Storm Trooper of the German-American Bund was arrested yesterday by agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation as a member of the alleged espionage ring uncovered over the week-end. His arrest brought to thirty-three the number of men and women who have been taken into custody in the case.
